intro: Oxydectes schlechtendaliana, commonly known as the Schlechtendaliana daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its compact size and vibrant blooms. Oxydectes schlechtendaliana is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
